title: docker build fails with missing git error
body:
**Describe the bug**
`docker build` fails with error message `4 0.537 /bin/sh: 1: git: not found`.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to `ludwig` root directory
2.` docker build -t ludwig_image` 

**Expected behavior**
Successful build of docker image

**Screenshots**
This is the docker build log:
```
docker build -t ludwig_test .
[+] Building 2.1s (5/6)
 => [internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                                                   0.1s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 466B                                                                                                   0.0s
 => [internal] load .dockerignore                                                                                                      0.0s
 => => transferring context: 2B                                                                                                        0.0s
 => [internal] load metadata for docker.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3                                                            1.2s
 => CACHED [1/3] FROM docker.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3@sha256:0b236338fac6c3361cf3ae1448f8c053994e260c1edc4fa63ed80adb3045a  0.0s
 => ERROR [2/3] RUN git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/uber/ludwig.git     && cd ludwig/     && pip install -r requirements.txt -  0.7s
------
 > [2/3] RUN git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/uber/ludwig.git     && cd ludwig/     && pip install -r requirements.txt -r requirements_text.txt           -r requirements_image.txt -r requirements_audio.txt           -r requirements_serve.txt -r requirements_viz.txt     && python setup.py install:
#4 0.537 /bin/sh: 1: git: not found
------
failed to solve with frontend dockerfile.v0: failed to build LLB: executor failed running [/bin/sh -c git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/uber/ludwig.git     && cd ludwig/     && pip install -r requirements.txt -r requirements_text.txt           -r requirements_image.txt -r requirements_audio.txt           -r requirements_serve.txt -r requirements_viz.txt     && python setup.py install]: runc did not terminate sucessfully
Jim-MacBook-Pro:jim ludwig[508]$
```

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOS
 - Version 10.15
- Python version: N/A
- Ludwig version: 0.2.1
- Docker version:  Docker Desktop for Mac 2.1.0.4

**Additional context**
Earlier version of Docker file contained `RUN apt-get install git` command.  This was removed in a recent change.  I'll submit PR to add back the command.
